This distrust and lack of support from established monarchy has led to persecution of fenri, especially in areas controlled by the dynasties. At one time there was a mass breakout of slaves, mostly fenri, in north western Xheros. Many of these slaves then made their made west across the desert in Cyranos and the Northlands. Some settled in places such as Nekri and Frigan, others continued to spread across Alvergia. This event is sometimes called the Fenri Exodus.
In Caligos, fenri are less common than humans but not rare and found all across the archipelago.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern colour in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Poison Susceptibility
entries: Your inability to vomit hinders your ability to handle poisons. You are vulnerable to poison damage and have disadvantage on saving throws to avoid or remove the poison condition.

entries.name: Disease Resistance
entries: You have advantage on saving throws to avoid or remove diseases.

entries.name: Hulking Frame
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} and {@skill Intimidation} skills.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: Plague Bite
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike you can force that creature to roll a DC12 Constitution saving throw or gain the {@condition poisoned} condition for 1 minute.

entries.name: The Plague
entries: Whenever you finish a long rest, you must roll a {@dice d20} and consult the table below to determine the effect. The effect lasts until the end of your next long rest, or until it is removed by the {@spell lesser restoration|phb} or {@spell greater restoration|phb} spell.

rows: You have disadvantge on all ability checks, attack rolls and saving throws.
You have disadvantge on all ability checks and saving throws.
You have disadvantge on Strength checks and saving throws.
You have disadvantge on Dexterity checks and saving throws.
You have disadvantge on Constitution checks and saving throws.
You have disadvantge on Intelligence checks and saving throws.
You have disadvantge on Wisdom checks and saving throws.
You have disadvantge on Charisma checks and saving throws.
When a creature fails the saving throw for your Plague Bite trait, they take an addtional {@dice 1d4} poison damage.
When a creature fails the saving throw for your Plague Bite trait, they take an addtional {@dice 2d4} poison damage.
When a creature fails the saving throw for your Plague Bite trait, they take an addtional {@dice 3d4} poison damage.

entries.name: Rodent Cunning
entries: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Lab Training
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

entries.name: Glyph Master
entries: You can spend one minute to read or write up to 25 words in any written language.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries: You have advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature, and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

entries.name: Street Smarts
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Wisdom (Survival) checks when in areas of heavy construction such as towns and dungeons.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Reveler
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Performance} and {@skill Persuasion} skills, and you have proficiency with one {@item musical instrument|phb} of your choice.

entries.name: Strong Willed
entries: You have advantage on saving throws to avoid being {@condition Charmed} or {@condition Frightened}.

entries.name: Quiet as a mouse
entries: You have proficiency in the Stealth skill.

entries.name: Mouse Nimbleness
entries: You count as one size smaller when determining your ability to squeeze through gaps, mount other creatures or move through the space of other creatures.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries: You can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Age
entries: Yamatlaca typically mature around 8 years of age. Yamatlaca rarely live beyond 50 years of age.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Yamatlaca often serve as guards for farmers and caravans, tending towards lawful and neutral alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: With their long necks upright, Yamatlaca typically stand just above 7 feet tall. Your size is medium

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Big Eyes, Bigger Ears
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on sight or hearing.

entries.name: Bold Beasts
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Spit
entries: Your spit is a natural ranged weapon, which you can use to make a ranged attack with a range of 30 feet (long range 60 feet). You are proficient with this attack. On a hit, you choose to deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Dexterity modifier. Alternatively you can forgo the damage of the attack and instead give the target disadvantge on its next attack roll.

entries.name: Thick Wool
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. You're also acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet.

entries.name: Hiker
entries: Your travel pace over mountain terrain is doubled as is the travel pace of up to ten companions while they're within 60 feet of you and you're not {@condition incapacitated|phb}.

entries.name: Sunbaked
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Sandwalker
entries: Your travel pace over desert terrain is doubled as is the travel pace of up to ten companions while they're within 60 feet of you and you're not {@condition incapacitated|phb}.

entries.name: Jungle Scavenger
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and you have resistance to poison damage.

entries.name: Jungle Delver
entries: Your travel pace in jungle terrain is doubled as is the travel pace of up to ten companions while they're within 60 feet of you and you're not {@condition incapacitated|phb}.

These large, courageous humanoids have bestial appearances resembling camelids, such as llamas, alpacas or camels. Their large eyes and ears grant them keen senses which, combined with their natural courage, make them popular as guards for farms and merchant caravans. However, you should never insult a Yamatlaca, else you may learn about their infamous spit the hard way.
Yamatlaca can be found in many climates, from the highest mountains to the hottest deserts and muggist swamp.
Yamatlaca typically mature around 15 years of age and can live up to around a century, though not many live past 70, especially those with harsh and dangerous lives.

entries.name: Yamatlaca across the multiverse
entries: In Alvergia, yamatlaca of all kinds are most often found in Solis. They have a reputation as dependable sentries and navigators, especially across the various biomes of Solis. Some have spread throughout Alvergia though they are an uncommon sight elsewhere.

In Caligos, yamatlaca are uncommon but often sought after when someone what to make to make dangerous treks between cities over land. Some yamatlaca are sick of this reputation and constantly being asked if they can hired to guide such suicide missions.

entries.name: Flight
entries: Because of your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Looks like a duck
entries: While not wearing armor or holding items, you are virtually indistinguishable from a large duck. A creature can make a DC15 Intelligence (Investigation) check to determine your true nature.

entries.name: Walks like a duck
entries: You can stand on and move across any liquid surface as if it were solid ground.

entries.name: Quacks like a duck
entries: You can communicate simple messages to ducks and other aquatic birds. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

The nature of these people has always confused scholars, even mallardians themselves may not be quite sure what they are and where their people came from. By most metrics they appear to be simple ducks, yet they can walk, talk and fight like other humanoids.

entries.name: Bad Flier
entries: Because of your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You fall at the end of a turn if you are airborne and the only thing holding you aloft is your flying speed.

entries.name: Glider
entries: When you are falling, and you are not {@condition incapacitated|phb}, you can use a reaction to slow your rate of descent to 60 feet per round. If you land while using this trait, you take no falling damage.

entries.name: Peck
entries: Your beak is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.
While these feathered beings resemble birds and possess wings, they are terrible fliers. They may have been mighty fliers once, but have found the ability waning over the many generations since.

entries.name: Sure-Footed
entries: Climbing does not cost you extra movement. In addition, you have advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock you prone.

entries.name: Wooly Coat
entries: While you have a full coat of wool you have resistance to cold damage, however you also have vulnerability to fire damage and disadvantage on saving throws against extreme heat.
If your coat is sheared over the course of 10 minutes, you lose the effects of this trait (unless you get them from another source) until your wool grows back after {@dice 1d6+1} days

entries.name: Headbutt
entries: You have a thick skull or heavy horns, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

A mountain people with hooves, horns and wooly coats, they are sometimes confused for goats or sheep, often to their annoyance. They frequently be found roaming the mountains and hills in large herds, finding comfort in crowds, though some lone wanderers make their way down from the hills.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Slimy
entries: You have advantage on rolls to avoid or escape the {@condition grappled|phb} condition.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries: Whenever you roll a hit die to regain hit points, you may add your proficiency bonus to the result of each roll. In addition, during a long rest, you can regrow any non-vital organs or limbs you have lost, such as arms, legs or eyes.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.
In the jungles and swamps of the world, many forms of life exist that can seem strange or alien to outsiders. This includes the Urodels, an amphibious and slimy people resembling large salamanders.
Also refered to as Axoes or Salamans, the Urodels are extraordinarily resilient thanks to their natural regeneration abilities, even regrowing entire limbs in a matter of hours.
Urodels mature after about 3 years and can theoretically live indefinitely thanks to their regeneration abiities, however, most only survive a few decades.

entries.name: Urodels across the multiverse
entries: Like in many worlds, urodels are rare in Alvergia and most commonly found in swamps, such as those found in the Peridot Marshes of Cyranos. Urodels seem to be solitary, hermit like creatures found deep in such swamps and rarely beyond.

entries.name: Deep Explorer
entries: Acclimated to underwater exploration, you have resistance to cold damage and can hold your breath for a number of hours equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 hour).

entries.name: Sonarsense
entries: Whilst in at least 2 foot of water and not {@condition deafened}, you have {@sense blindsight} out to 30 feet. This sense cannot extend outside the body of water you are in.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Ocean Giant
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying weight and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. In addition, you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks while you are submerged underwater.

entries.name: Whalesong
entries: You can communicate messages over vast distances by singing them in whalesong, which can be sung in any language. It takes four times as long to say anything in whalesong, but you can be heard and understood up to 600 feet away, or up to a mile away underwater.

entries.name: Far Song
entries: Once you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell sending|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. If both you and the target are submerged in water, you can use an additional action before the end of your next turn to send a second message to the same target and receive another reply. You do not need to be in the same body of water as the target to make this second message.
Once you cast the spell with this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of 3rd level or higher.

entries.name: Deft Swimmer.
entries: Your swimming speed increases by 10 feet

entries.name: Aquatic Acrobat
entries: If you have been fully submerged in water at some point on the current turn, your jump distance is doubled and you have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks and Dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Torpedo Charge
entries: If you move at least 20 feet in a straight line immediately before hitting a target with a melee attack, you can deal an extra {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage to that target. If both you and the target are submerged underwater when you make the attack, this extra damage increases to {@dice 1d8}.

Also known as cetaceans, hvalrfolk or finfolk, tohorans are water loving humanoids, often with blue-grey skin, fins and blowholes, bearing a resemblance to whales, dolphins and other aquatic mammals. While they do typically require air to survive, they can be comfortable hundreds or even thousands of feet below the water. Tohorans range from the large, powerful giants with deep and beautiful singing voices, to the more slender, nimble folk, known for elaborate acrobatics and whistles.

Most tohorans mature in their late teens, and typically live up to around 80 years. Larger tohorons tend to age slower after reaching maturity, and often live a decade or so longer. In rare cases, some individuals can vastly outlive expectations, living as many as 200 years. These long-lived individuals often become figures of renown in tohoran cultures and religions.

entries.name: Tohorans across the multiverse
entries: In Alvergia, tohorans are most often found in ocean depths and around remote islands, such as the Prestonia Archipelgo, where their songs are revered and can often be heard all across the islands. These songs play significant roles within the cultural, spiritual and magical rituals of tohoran tribes there. Led by shamans, often known as tohungas, these rituals typically reflect a spiritual connection to the ocean, incorporating shells, saltwater and squid ink for anointments and ingestion, as well as frequently taking place within the ocean or shallows.

There are also rumours of remote clans of tohorans in the Northlands, often described with black and white markings or with large spear-like horns. It is unclear if these features are artificial, or some form of natural divergence.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Draconic Cry.
entries: As a bonus action, you let out a cry at your enemies within 10 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn, you and your allies have advantage on attack rolls against any of those enemies who could hear you. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Wilderness Legacy
entries: Accustomed to life in the wild, you have adapted to extreme environments. Choose one of the following legacy options for your kobold.

items: {@b {@i Cave Dweller.}} The range of your darkvsion increases to 120ft. In addition, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain or dim light.
{@b {@i Cliff Climber.}} You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, you can jump up to your full long jump or high jump distance, even without a running start.
{@b {@i Sea Diver.}} You have a Swimming speed equal to your walking speed and can breathe underwater.

entries.name: Mutant Legacy
entries: You have developed some mutation that separates you from other kobolds. Choose one of the following legacy options for your kobold.

items: {@b {@i Draconic Hide.}} You have resistance to one of the following damage types (choose when you select this race); acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant or thunder.

{@b {@i Tiny Target.}} You have a +1 bonus to your armor class. In addition, you count as one size smaller when determining your ability to squeeze through gaps, mount other creatures or move through the space of other creatures.

{@b {@i Vicious Weapons.}} You have sharp teath, claws, horns or tail spikes which you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with it, the strike deals {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier piercing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Talented Legacy
entries: Whether through intense training, family tradition or just dumb luck, you have mastered certain unorthodox techniques that distinguish you from other kobolds. Choose one of the following legacy options for your kobold.

items: {@b {@i Master Slinger.}} When you wield a {@item sling|phb}, its damage die changes from a {@dice d4} to a {@dice d6}. (This benefit has no effect if another feature has already improved the weapon's die). In addition, your ranged attacks with slings ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

{@b {@i Potent Inventor.}} You have proficiency in one of the following tools of your choice: {@item alchemist's supplies|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, {@item herbalism kit|phb}, {@item poisoner's kit|phb}.

{@b {@i Scrambling Cavalier.}} Mounting a willing creature only costs you 5 feet of movement. While mounted, you can use a bonus action to increase your mount's speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn, provided you are still mounted on them.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Glowstalk
entries: You have a bioluminescent stalk extending from your head. As bonus action, you can let out a pulse of dim light out to 20 feet until the start of your next turn. You and your allies have advantage on attack rolls against enemies within this dim light who are not also within bright light. If any of these attacks hits a creature that has an Intelligence score of 4 or lower, the attack deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Deep Legacy
entries: Adaptations to thalassic depths can manifest in different ways for each kobold. Choose one of the following legacy options for your kobold.

items.name: Aquatic Cavalier
entries: You can mount or dismount a creature that has a swimming speed with only 5 feet of movement. You also have advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks to maintain control of a mount that has a swimming speed.

items.name: Extreme Depths
entries: Acclimated to low temperatures and high pressures, you have resistance to cold and thunder damage.

items.name: Thalassic Sniper
entries: Being underwater does not cause your ranged weapon attacks to fail at long range, nor does it impose disadvantage at normal range.

Just as dragons can be found in every corner of the material plane, so too can kobolds. This includes the deepest reaches of the ocean, where sunlight is as alien as the extraplanar. Just like their surface counterparts, deep kobolds are often underestimated due to their size, but their cunning and cooperation can make them extremely dangerous, especially to those unfamiliar with the depths. Unlike other kobolds however, deep kobolds do not appear to posses the voice of dragons, instead bearing bioluminescent stalks upon their foreheads which can be used to lure and distract prey.

entries.name: Deep Kobolds Across the Multiverse
entries: In Alvergia, deep kobolds are very rare, and typically only found at the very bottom of the deepest oceans. Very few make it to the shallower seas, even fewer to the surface. However, small groups have been known to mingle with other groups of aquatic peoples, particularly around the lonely islands. Deep kobolds have occasionally been spotted seemingly riding whales and tohorans in the depths of the Azure ocean. The relationship exhibited here is unclear.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Thalian Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison and fire damage.

entries.name: Dwarven Combat Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, and {@item warhammer|phb}.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, such as ancient columns or statues, you are considered proficient in the {@skill History} skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: Thalian Cyclopes mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Thalian Cyclopes tend to be neutral, prefering to dedicate to their craft rather than politics or tradition.

entries.name: Size
entries: Thalian Cyclopes are between 7 and 8 feet tall and weigh between 280 and 340 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Thalian Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison and fire damage.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Magic Forgemaster
entries: You can cast the {@spell identify|phb} spell as a ritual. You don't require material components when you cast it using this feature.

entries.name: Poor Depth Perception
entries: You have disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.
Deep under the mighty volcano of Thalia generations of cyclopes have laboured for thousands of years, producing some of the greatest weapons in the known world, including the thunderbolts of Zeus.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Small or Medium. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Mineral Body
entries: You do not need to breathe, eat or drink.

entries.name: Mineral Hide
entries: As a bonus action, you can coat yourself in a hardened layer of minerals for 1 minute, or until you are {@condition incapacitated}. For this duration, you gain temporary hit points equal to three times your proficiency bonus. While you have these temporary hit points, you are also immune to damage type associated with your Earthen Flesh trait.

entries.name: Earthen Flesh
entries: Your flesh is made mostly or entirely of crystals and gemstones. You have resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Diamond Mind
entries: You have advantage on saving throws to avoid or remove the {@condition charmed|phb} and {@condition frightened|phb} conditions.

entries.name: Gemstone Skin
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in crystalline terrain or among other gemstones and similar treasures.

entries.name: Gaian Manifestation
entries: Your connection to your source can manifest in different ways in an individual gaian. Choose one of the following manifestation options for your gaian.

items.name: Fingers of Quartz
entries: When you make an unarmed strike, you can transform your fingers or hands into shards of crystal. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier psychic damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

items.name: Heart of Ruby
entries: You know the {@spell mind sliver|tce} cantrip. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this race).

items.name: Jewel Affinity
entries: You have proficiency with {@item jeweler's tools|phb} and advantage on checks made using them.

entries.name: Earthen Flesh
entries: Your flesh is made mostly or entirely of magical ice or snow. You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Glacial Walker
entries: Slippery ice and deep snow do not count as {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for you, and you automatically pass saving throws to avoid failing prone on slippery ice.

entries.name: Arctic Skin
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in icy or snowy terrain.

entries.name: Gaian Manifestation
entries: Your connection to your source can manifest in different ways in an individual gaian. Choose one of the following manifestation options for your gaian.

items.name: Fingers of Frost
entries: When you make an unarmed strike, you can transform your fingers or hands into icicles. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier cold damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

items.name: Heart of Ice
entries: You know the {@spell frostbite|xge} cantrip. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this race).

items.name: Ice Skater
entries: By briefly freezing the ground at your feet, you can stand on and move across any liquid surface as if it were solid ground.

entries.name: Earthen Flesh
entries: Your flesh is made mostly or entirely of magma, lava or smoldering coal. You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Mantle Swimmer
entries: Lava and magma pose no threat to you. You take no damage from it, and have a swim speed equal to your walking speed while submerged in it.

entries.name: Scorched Skin
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in magma, lava, ashy terrain or burned buildings.

entries.name: Gaian Manifestation
entries: Your connection to your source can manifest in different ways in an individual gaian. Choose one of the following manifestation options for your gaian.

items.name: Fingers of Flame
entries: When you make an unarmed strike, you can transform your fingers or hands into tendrils of lava and flame. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier fire damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

items.name: Heart of Fire
entries: You know the {@spell produce flame|phb} cantrip. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this race).

items.name: Burning Blood
entries: At the end of a long rest, you can produce a number of flasks of {@item alchemist's fire (flask)|phb|alchemist's fire} equal to your proficiency bonus. These flasks last until they are used or until the end of your next long rest.

entries.name: Earthen Flesh
entries: Your flesh is made mostly or entirely of granules of sand, silt, salt or fine gravel. You have resistance to piercing damage.

entries.name: Soft Landing
entries: By spreading your weight upon landing, you take half damage from falling, provided you are not incapacitated.

entries.name: Granular Skin
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in sand, gravel or salty terrain.

entries.name: Gaian Manifestation
entries: Your connection to your source can manifest in different ways in an individual gaian. Choose one of the following manifestation options for your gaian.

items.name: Fingers of Glass
entries: When you make an unarmed strike, you can transform your fingers or hands into shards of glass. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier piercing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

items.name: Heart of Silt
entries: You know the {@spell sandblast|J:Gaian} cantrip. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this race).

items.name: Sharp Surface
entries: As an action, you can spray sharp crystals on the ground in a 5-foot square. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or take piercing damage equal to your proficiency bonus and have its walking speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn. These sharp crystals disintegrate after 1 minute. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Earthen Flesh
entries: Your flesh is made mostly or entirely of unstable metal, stone or stardust. Your body is constantly undergoing small scale reactions, producing faint flashes and tingles. You have resistance to radiant damage.

entries.name: Warming Glow
entries: As an action, you can begin to emit dim light out to 10 feet. This light lasts until you dismiss it with another action, or you die. Creatures within this light feel a comforting warmth, have advantage on saving throws against extreme cold and regain 1 additional hit point for each Hit Die they roll during a short rest. You can also use this light to gently heat food.

entries.name: Twinkling Skin
entries: You have advantage on Charisma checks where your sparkly appearance may aid you, such as during a stage performance or attempting to appear otherworldly.

entries.name: Gaian Manifestation
entries: Your connection to your source can manifest in different ways in an individual gaian. Choose one of the following manifestation options for your gaian.

items.name: Fingers of Light
entries: When you make an unarmed strike, you can transform your fingers or hands into shards of glass. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier radiant damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

items.name: Heart of Energy
entries: You know the {@spell word of radiance|xge} cantrip. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this race).

items.name: Extreme Glow
entries: While your Warming Glow is active, you can use a bonus action to amplify its effects to potentially dangerous levels for 1 minute, or until you dismiss it with another bonus action. For the duration, any creature other than you that takes radiant or necrotic damage while inside the light's area takes additional damage of the same type equal to your proficiency bonus. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Gaians are beings awakened from the natural minerals of the world itself. Despite being composed of typically nonliving matter, these people are very much conscious, living beings in their own right. No one is quite sure how they are awakened, though many suspect the whims of gods or nature spirits are often involved.

Gaians are usually awakened fully mature and alone with no families of their own, save the bonds they make with other creatures. They tend to be more malleable within the first few weeks, able to subtly alter their form and learn rapidly. As such, they usually adopt the forms, languages and cultures of those they interact with shortly after being awakened. Most will typically settle into a more unchanging body and mind after a short while, finding it harder to change thereafter, as if they had been that way for many years.

Gaians seem to come from almost any source of unliving minerals. From hot magma, freezing permafrost, precious gemstones or even mysterious metal ores found deep below the surface or in meteorites. Combined with their malleability in early days, this leads to a wide variety of appearances within gaians.

No lifespan limit is known for gaians and they show no physical signs of aging. However they can still be wearied by time and those who do not fall to injury or disease will sometimes willingly return their source when they feel their time is up. These lifespans are greatly varied though unstable gaians always seem to expire sooner than other variants.

entries.name: Gaians across the multiverse
entries: In Alvergia, gaians are rare. However, they can be more common in regions with extreme climates and usual magics. Magma gaians may sometimes be found on volcanic islands. Ice gaians have been rumored to be spotted in the far north or atop snow covered peaks. Gem and Unstable gaians might awaken deep underground or from meteorites. The sands of Xheros and the woods of Xia have been known to spit out unusual phenomenon, perhaps gaians can be counted among them. Due to their rarity, knowledge of these people and the nature of their creation is limited. A few mages who are aware of them have become fascinated by them, and obsessed with trying to replicate their creation.

In Caligos, gaians are extremely rare. Though it has been rumored that Ice gaians exist in the freezing wastes between cities or even that magma gaians help to operate the underground rails systems, heating engines without being impaired by the heat or toxic atmosphere.

In Delamir, extreme conditions brought about by the wild magics of the rifts give rise to wondrous and terrible creatures alike. While some creatures with this origin seek to end life that they find, some simply look to make their own way in the world. Gaians are another manifestation of magic: otherworldly lightning turning a rock to magma, powerful magic reversing the usual process and bringing life to a collection of sunshards, or ancient titanic spirits murmuring and bringing the world around them to life. While Gaians are not common, they hold a similar role to the Genasi of the world: elements given life, as opposed to life given elements. As such, they will find themselves accepted in any society. What is walking magma compared to dragons in the clouds, or eyes and whispers in the darkness?

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Celestial Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage and radiant damage.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Healing Hands
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and roll a number of d4s equal to your proficiency bonus. The creature regains a number of hit points equal to the total rolled. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Light Bearer
entries: You know the {@spell light} cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Celestial Revelation
entries: When you reach 3rd level, choose one of the revelation options below. Thereafter, you can use a bonus action to unleash the celestial energy and regal training within yourself, gaining the benefits of that revelation. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. Once you transform using your revelation below, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Impossible Artistry
items.entry: You appear to bend the laws of reality to create and manipulate items in logic defying ways, such as opening a locked door from the other side or cutting a tensioned tripwire without triggering a trap. You become proficient with {@item thieves' tools|phb} and two sets of {@filter artisan tools|items|source=|type=artisan's tools} of your choice for the duration. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, when you would deal damage or healing to a construct or object, you can deal additional damage or healing equal to your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Limited Omniscience
items.entry: You grow additional eyes and expand your senses, these eyes are not necessarily visible or even physically attached your body. Choose up to three willing creatures you can see within 10 feet of you. For the duration, you can perceive through their senses simultaneously with your own. This effect ends early on a creature if they are ever more than 30 feet from you. In addition, until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can choose a creature who's senses you are viewing. When that creature next deals damage to a target with an attack or a spell before the start of your next turn, it deals additional radiant damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Voice of Angels
items.entry: Your voice becomes booming and angelic, commanding authority, respect and fear. Creatures that can hear you within 10 feet must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or become {@condition charmed} by you, or {@condition frightened} if it is a fiend or undead, until the end of your next turn. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra psychic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

entries: {@race Aasimar|mpmm}, mortal beings infused with celestial energy are rare. Rarer still are those infused with a particular strain celestial energy, known as royal aasimar. In addition to unleashing this energy as light, healing or destruction, they can channel into their minds, voices and the world around them, seemingly performing miracles.

Like other aasimar, these aasimar can arise among any population of mortals. They resemble their parents, but they live for up to 160 years and often have features that hint at their celestial heritage. These often begin subtle and become more obvious when the aasimar gains the ability to reveal their full celestial nature. The Royal Aasimar Celestial Features table has examples you can choose or use as inspiration to create your own.

entries.caption: Royal Aasimar Celestial Features
rows: A dusting of metallic, white, or charcoal freckles
An unusual hue tinting your shadow
A ghostly halo crowning your head
Small metallic or ceramic looking horns emerge from your head, resembling the points of a crown
Metallic gold, silver or black fingernails
Small vestigial wings emerging from your ankles or wrists
White or gold feathers in your hair or in a bird like plume on your head
Touching metal or marble surfaces with your bare hands or feet leaves a faint, pale glow for a few seconds
Gold or black lines surrounding your eyes, resembling elaborate makeup

entries.name: Royal Aasimar across the Multiverse
entries: In Alvergia, aasimar can be found most prominently among the upper classes of Ilahli. Some of these aasimar, most notably the royal family, will claim a much richer source of celestial energy within their lineage. Sometimes called royal aasimar or pure aasimar, these individuals use their allegedly stronger divinity to subtly bend the rules and expectations of reality. This challenging of reality has become an steadfast tradition in the royal family, with each generation attempting more and more seemingly impossible feats of art, culture and engineering, even if not always directly.

Despite how exclusive the royal family can be about their bloodline, this rarer form of celestial energy can find its way to others throughout Ilahli and Alvergia. While extremely rare, even the simplest commoner might unexpectedly develop powers normally believed to be reserved for kings and queens. This has, on occasion, led to assumptions about the parentage of bastards and has even allowed pretenders to challenge the royal dynasty, with little success however.

items.name: Celestial Revelation (Impossible Artistry)
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you can use a bonus action to transform yourself. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. Once you transform using your revelation, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

You appear to bend the laws of reality to create and manipulate items in logic defying ways, such as opening a locked door from the other side or cutting a tensioned tripwire without triggering a trap. You become proficient with thieves tools and two sets of artisan tools of your choice for the duration. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, when you would deal damage or healing to a construct or object, you can deal additional damage or healing equal to your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Celestial Revelation (Limited Omniscience)
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you can use a bonus action to transform yourself. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. Once you transform using your revelation, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

You grow additional eyes and expand your senses, these eyes are not necessarily visible or even physically attached your body. Choose up to three willing creatures you can see within 10 feet of you. For the duration, you can perceive through their senses simultaneously with your own. This effect ends early on a creature if they are ever more than 30 feet from you. In addition, until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can choose a creature who's senses you are viewing. When that creature next deals damage to a target with an attack or a spell before the start of your next turn, it deals additional radiant damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Celestial Revelation (Voice of Angels)
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you can use a bonus action to transform yourself. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. Once you transform using your revelation, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Your voice becomes booming and angelic, commanding authority, respect and fear. Creatures that can hear you within 10 feet must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or become charmed by you, or frightened if it is a fiend or undead, until the end of your next turn. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra psychic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Ancestral Legacy
entries: If you replace a race with this lineage, you can keep the following elements of that race: any skill proficiencies you gained from it and any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it.
If you don't keep any of those elements or you choose this lineage at character creation, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Squeakers
entries: As an action, you can transform a pair of footwear you touch into squeakers that squeak when the wearer walks. The squeaking can be heard out to a range of 30 feet and lasts for 1 hour or until you use this trait again. If a creature is wearing the footwear when you use this action, it can make a Charisma saving throw to prevent the transformation. The DC for this saving throw is equal to 8 + your Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma modifier (choose when you select this lineage) + your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Circus Tricks
entries: You know one of the following cantrips of your choice; {@spell acid splash|phb}, {@spell friends|phb}, {@spell mage hand|phb}, {@spell prestidigitation|phb} or {@spell shocking grasp|phb}. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it (choose when you select this lineage).

entries.name: Phantasmal Illusions
entries: You can cast {@spell disguise self|phb} with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell mirror image|phb} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, when you cast {@spell disguise self|phb}, you can appear as a creature or object that is your size or one size smaller, such as a child or floating balloon. Once you cast any of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this lineage).

Excessive consumption of Thrill Joy, an elixir distilled from demonic ichor and the nectar of the bozo flower, can transform humanoids into fiendish creatures resembling clowns. Space clowns remain mostly lucid but often their minds are warped, increasing their desire for festivity, frivoloty and trickery. This can push some to cruel extremes, but not always.

entries.name: Creture Tyoe
entries: Your creature type is fey rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for up to 10 minutes at a time.

entries.name: Telepathy
entries: You can speak telepathically to any creature within 30 feet of you. The creature understands you only if the two of you share a language. You can speak telepathically in this way to a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus at a time.

entries.name: Mind Reading
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell detect thoughts|phb} spell once using this trait. Once you cast the spell with this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of 2nd level or higher.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Cold Resistance
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Slide
entries: Being {@condition prone} does not slow your movement and, while prone, you can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours without it counting as difficult terrain. In addition, opportunity attacks against you do not gain advantage due to you being prone.

Dohwars are short, pudgy, flightless avians that look and move like penguins. Dohwar are commonly found as merchants across wildspace, though smaller, more varied communities are found across the multiverse. They tend to dress in a garish mishmash of clothing, but many of them also shroud themselves in hooded cloaks.

Some dohwars have separated from their psionic, space-faring kin. Dweling for generations in frozen biomes, they have adapted to cold and icy environments. This adaptation comes at the cost of their psionic abilities.

spell.name: Time Stasis
entries: This spell lets you freeze a creature or object in time. Choose a creature, of size Large or smaller, or a non-magical object, that is not greater than 10ft in any dimension, that you can see within range. If the target is a creature or is an object carried or worn by a creature, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be frozen in time for the spell's duration.
While frozen, a target is {@condition incapacitated|phb}, can't move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings. It is also unaffected by any external forces such as gravity, attacks and spells.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can affect one additional creature or object for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Tin's Force Ballista
entries: You fire a small dart of magically compressed matter at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 1d8} force damage. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 5 feet in a straight line away from you.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Boomerang Blade

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You launch the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a ranged attack with it against a creature you can see within 30 feet of you, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and takes an additional {@dice 1d4} force damage. Hit or miss the weapon then returns to your hand.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Reverse Teleport
entries: You choose a creature you are familiar with. If the creature is willing, is on the same plane of existence as you and is not {@condition incapacitated}, they are then instantly transported to a space within 10 feet of you.
The creature instinctively understands that the spell will transport them and recognizes you as the caster if it knows you but it does not know where it will transported to.

spell.name: Arcane Mirror
entries: You create a magic, spectral mirror, that is no larger than 5 feet in any dimension, at a point you can see within range. Whenever a spell, that is cast in a line, hits the mirror, it is reflected at an angle of your choice for the remainder of its range and the mirror is destroyed. If this would result in a creature or object being hit by the spell multiple times, they are subjected to the effects of the spell for each time.
On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use a bonus action to move the mirror up to 30 feet in any direction. If the mirror is ever more than 30 feet from you, it is destroyed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can create two mirrors simultaneously and move them both independently with the same bonus action. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you can create and control up to three mirrors simultaneously.

spell.name: Bazoz's Spicy Water
entries: You choose a volume of liquid that is primarily water, that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. The liquid may be separated into multiple groups or containers, provided they still fit within the 5-foot cube. You produce up to three of the following effects in the liquid for the spell's duration.

items: You fill the liquid with faintly glowing bubbles. You choose the color, size and density of these bubbles.
You make the liquid move in a simple repeating pattern, such as a small whirlpool, fountain or convection current. This movement is not strong enough to move or harm creatures or objects.
You make the liquid slowly change color or opacity every few seconds. In addition, you can make the liquid glow, producing dim light within 10ft.

You give the liquid a smell, flavor and temperature of your choice. The temperature change cannot be so great that the liquid would boil, freeze, or be directly harmful to creatures it wasn't previously.
You increase or decrease the potency of any non-magical substances in the liquid, such as alcohol or caffeine. You cannot alter the effects of poisons or potions in this way.
You alter the buoyancy of tiny objects or creatures in the liquid. This effect cannot move an unwilling creature or alter a creature's movement speed in the liquid.

entries: You may also suggest additional effects if your DM allows. None of the effects may directly harm or move creatures. You can dispel any of the effects you created at any point (no action required).
The maximum duration of this spell increases up to 24 hours when you reach 5th level, up to 7 days at 11th level, and up to 1 year at 17th level.

spell.name: Greater Ceremony

components.m: 500 gp worth of powdered silver, which the spell consumes

entries: You perform a special religious ceremony that is infused with magic. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following rites, the target of which must be within 10 feet of you throughout the casting.
{@b Communion.} You touch one humanoid who wishes to speak directly to your god. They can cast the {@spell commune|phb} spell once as a ritual and without providing material components.

{@b Last Will and Testament.} You touch a humanoid that wishes to leave possessions with another when they die. The target names a creature they are familiar with to be their heir. When the target dies, their body, along with any items they are wearing or carrying, are transported magically to a space within 5ft of the heir, even across planes. If the heir themselves is dead, the items do not teleport. A target can gain this rite again to change their designated heir, they may only have one heir at a time. The target loses this rite when they die.

{@b Oath of Friendship.} You touch two humanoids who wish to never harm one another. These targets are permanently {@condition charmed} by each other (even if they are otherwise immune to the charmed condition) and cannot perform any action that would directly harm the other, even if compelled to do so by any means short of a {@spell wish|phb} spell. A target can only benefit from this rite once and loses it if either of the targets dies.

{@b Procreation.} You touch adult humanoids who wish to have a child together, regardless of their number, their fertility or the combination of their races and sexes. One of the targets becomes pregnant. Alternatively, an egg or artificial womb is created externally within 10 feet of you. After an appropriate amount of time (or {@dice 2d6+2} months), a child is born or hatches. The race and statistics of the child are decided by the DM. A target can only benefit from this rite again after the child is born, hatched or dies.
{@b Purity Ward.} You touch one humanoid that wishes to remain pure. The target is immune to disease, immune to lycanthropy and can't become undead by any means short of a {@spell wish|phb} spell.

{@b Standing Vigil.} You touch one humanoid who wishes to protect a particular creature, location or object. While they are within 30ft of the subject of their protection, they do not need to eat, drink or sleep and when they take a long rest, they appear inert and motionless but are not rendered {@condition unconscious|phb}, and they can see and hear as normal. A creature can benefit from this rite only once and loses the rite if the subject of their protection dies or is destroyed.

{@b Transition.} You touch one humanoid that wishes to permanently change their age, appearance, race or sex. The target describes what they wish to be and, if the DM allows, they are then transformed. If the target changes race, they take on the racial traits and ability score improvements of their new race and discard the ones of their previous race. If the target's current form is the result of a curse or other magic effect, this rite has no effect until the curse or effect is removed. A creature can only benefit from this rite once.

{@b Undying Devotion.} You touch a target who wishes to serve your god, even after death. If a spell, such as {@spell raise dead|phb}, has the sole effect of restoring them to life (but not undeath), the caster doesn't need material components to cast the spell on them. A creature can benefit from this rite only once and loses the rite once it is used.

spell.name: Spectral Crew

components.m: a piece of debris from a shipwreck

entries: You touch a non-magical ship and summon up to 10 spectral sailors to crew it for the spell's duration. These spectral sailors do not fight or perform any actions not directly related to crewing the ship, but they are added to the crew numbers of the ship for the purposes of determining possible ship actions and will obey a captain's orders. This spell ends early if you are ever more than 100ft from the ship.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you summon up to 10 additional sailors for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ray of Impotence
entries: Choose one of the following damage types; acid, cold, fire, lightning, force, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with chosen damage type until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Ray of Lumbering
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Dexterity until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Rising Words
entries: You target a creature in range and utter a phrase or joke so abhorrent to the creature that you awaken a furious anger inside them. The targeted creature can immediately use a reaction (even if they are {@condition unconscious}) to move up to its movement speed toward you, without provoking opportunity attacks, before making an unarmed strike against you.

The target can choose to use your spellcasting ability modifier in place of its Strength modifier for the attack roll and damage. On a hit, you suffer the attack's normal effects and the creature regains hit points equal to twice the damage dealt.
If the targeted creature is {@condition unconscious} and does not hit you with an attack, or still has 0 hit points after the attack, it remains {@condition unconscious} once the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the amount of hit points regained by the creature on a hit increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Runner's Rope
entries: You fire a magical dart at an object you can see within range that is Huge or larger, or that is fixed in place (such as a wall or ceiling). The dart remains fixed to the target for the spell's duration, and a 30ft long magic rope extends from the dart to your empty hand. You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks you make using the rope.
When you cast the spell, or as a subsequent bonus action on each of your turns for the spell's duration, you can touch the rope and perform one of the following actions:

items: {@b {@i Reel In.}} You reduce the length of the rope by up to 30ft. Any creatures grasping the rope are moved towards the dart by a number of feet equal to the number you reduce the rope by, following the path of the rope. A creature that is not {@condition restrained} by the rope can let go of the rope at any point during this movement to stop moving.
{@b {@i Reel Out.}} You extend the length of the rope by up to 30ft (to a maximum of 100ft).
{@b {@i Reshoot.}} The dart and rope vanish, and you fire a new dart at a new target within range.

spell.name: Chain Blade

components.m: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You touch the weapon used in the spell's casting and chains extend from your wrist to the weapon. Until the start of your next turn, that weapon's reach is 5 feet greater than normal.

This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, melee attacks with the weapon deal an extra {@dice 1d4} force damage to the target on a hit. This damage increases by {@dice 1d4} at 11th level ({@dice 2d4}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d4}).

spell.name: Caustic Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during the spell's duration, your weapon emits a burst of caustic acid, and the attack deals an extra {@dice 1d6} acid damage to the target. Each creature other than you that is within 5 feet of the target (including the target) must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 1d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, both the initial damage and the damage dealt to creatures within 5 feet increase by {@dice 1d6} each for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Merciful Touch

components.m: A coin worth at least 1cp which the spell consumes and a bowl

entries: You touch a willing creature and imbue them with the magic of mercy. For the duration, when the target reduces a creature to 0 hit points, they can choose to incapacitate the creature rather than killing them. The creature is {@condition unconscious} and stable.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Explosive Propulsion

components.m: a pinch of metallic powder and a fuse

entries: You touch a willing creature and choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant or thunder. The target gains a flying speed of 40 feet for the duration, as if propelled by matter or energy of the chosen type. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.

Additionally, for the spell's duration, if the target flies 15ft or more in a straight line immediately before making a melee attack or impacting a solid surface, such as the ground or a wall, they can choose to emit a blast of destructive energy. Any creatures within 10ft of the target (excluding the target itself) must make a must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 3d6} damage of the chosen type on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage dealt by the burst increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Silencing Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon utters a harsh, shushing noise, and the attack deals an extra {@dice 2d6} psychic damage to the target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be silenced until the spell ends. While silenced, the creature cannot speak or cast spells with verbal components.

spell.name: Timber

components.m: a twig from a large tree

entries: You rapidly transform yourself into a tree and slam downwards, crushing those beneath you. Each creature in a 20-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 3d8} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and is not knocked prone.
When the spell ends, you transform back into your original form. You can remain in the same space or choose to reappear in an unoccupied space of your choice within the spell's area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can transform into a larger tree, increasing the area of this spell to a 30-foot cone (4th-level), 40-foot cone (6th level) or a 60-foot cone (8th-level).

spell.name: Crackling Bolt
entries: A bolt of lightning shoots towards a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 1d8} lightning damage, and it has disadvantage on the next Dexterity saving throw it makes before the end of its next turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Flaming Fingers
entries: A flickering flame appears in your hand. The flame remains there for the duration and harms neither you nor your equipment. The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The spell ends if you dismiss it as an action or if you cast it again.
When you cast the spell, or as a subsequent action while you have this flame, you can produce one of the following effects with it:

items: You double or halve the area of bright light and dim light cast by the flame, change its color, or both.

You ignite a flammable object you touch that is not being worn or carried by a creature other than you. Once the object is ignited, you can immediately pull your hand away to avoid taking fire damage as a result of touching the burning object.

You cause simple shapes���such as the vague form of a creature, an inanimate object, or a location���to appear within the flames and animate as you like. The shapes must fit in your hand (or just above it) and last until the start of your next turn.
You cool the flame and safely dry up to a square foot of a wet creature or object you touch without burning it.

entries: {@note If you use the Evolving Cantrips supplement, you gain the following additional benefits when you reach certain levels.}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At 5th Level
entries: You can use the flame as an action to ignite a flammable object you can see within 15 feet of you that is not being worn or carried by a creature other than you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At 11th Level
entries: You can make up to two flames appear simultaneously, each in a different hand. You can produce simultaneous effects with each flame as part of the same action. You may choose the same effect or a different one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At 17th Level
entries: You can ignite up to three objects simultainiously with each flame.

spell.name: Speech Jam

components.m: a metal tube or horn bent into a loop

entries: You choose a target you can see within range and attempt to create a feedback loop between its speech and hearing, confusing its mind and forcing it to speak slower than normal. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or become speech jammed for the spell's duration or until they are {@condition deafened}. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the effect on a success.

While speech jammed, the target speaks in a slow drawl. They have disadvantage on Charisma checks that rely on speech and they take longer to cast spells with verbal components. If the spell normally requires a reaction, they can no longer cast it. If the spell normally requires a bonus action, it now requires an action. If the spell normally requires an action, it now requires two actions.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shape Weapon

components.m: a piece of paper folded into the shape of a weapon

entries: You choose a nonmagical weapon that you can see in range and alter its geometry. You might make an edge sharper or duller, make a blade longer or shorter, alter the weight balance or another similar effect.

For the spell's duration, the weapon's damage type becomes your choice of bludgeoning, piercing or slashing and attacks with it have a {@dice 1d6} bonus or penalty (choose when you cast this spell) to damage rolls (to a minimum of 1 damage). If you choose to grant a bonus to damage, attacks with the weapon count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
If the weapon is being worn or carried by an unwilling creature when you cast the spell, that creature can make a Charisma saving throw to prevent the effects of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 5th-level or higher, you can add or remove one of the following properties on the weapon for every two levels above 3rd; heavy, finesse, light and reach. This effect lasts for the spell's duration.

spell.name: Bloat/Trim

components.m: a handful of blubber or lard

entries: You cause a creature or an object you can see within range to grow larger or smaller for the duration, modifying and redistributing its mass to help or hinder it. Choose either a creature or an object that is neither worn nor carried. If the target is unwilling, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect.
If the target is a creature, everything it is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item dropped by an affected creature returns to normal size at once.

entries.name: Bloat
entries: The target's size doubles in all dimensions, and its weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases its size by one category���from Medium to Large, for example. If there isn't enough room for the target to double its size, the creature or object attains the maximum possible size in the space available. Until the spell ends, the target also has disadvantage on Dexterity checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also grow to match its new size, becoming unbalanced and unwieldy. While these weapons are bloated, the target has a {@dice 1d4} penalty to attack rolls with them.

entries.name: Trim
entries: The target's size is halved in all dimensions, and its weight is reduced to one-eighth of normal. This reduction decreases its size by one category���from Medium to Small, for example. Until the spell ends, the target also has advantage on Dexterity checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also shrink to match its new size, feeling lighter and handling easier. While these weapons are trimmed, the target has a {@dice 1d4} bonus to attack rolls with them.

spell.name: Switch
entries: Choose two willing creatures you can see within range that are not {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained} (this can include yourself). Both creatures then instantly swap places.

spell.name: Compress/Stretch

components.m: a spring or piece of rubber

entries: You warp space in a 60-foot cone in one of the following ways for the spell's duration:
{@b {@i Compress.}} A creature moving through the area only spends 1 foot of movement for every 2 feet it moves inside the area.
{@b {@i Stretch.}} Any creature other than you must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves inside the area.

spell.name: Unshakeable Tail
entries: You target a creature within range and bind your position to theirs. An unwilling creature can make a Charisma saving throw to avoid the effects. For the duration, if the target moves, you also move the same distance and in the same direction simultaneously. For example, if the target walks 10 feet northwards, you are also moved 10 feet northwards.

The spell does not hold you aloft or allow you to pass through obstacles that you normally couldn't, such as walls or other creatures. Your movement, or lack of movement, does not affect theirs. You are not moved if a creature teleports, such as with the misty step spell. The spell ends early if you are ever more than 30ft from the target.

spell.name: Sandblast

components.m: a pinch of sand, salt or silt

entries: You launch a blast of sand, salt or silt at a creature within range that has unshielded eyes. That creature must make a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. The creature, or another creature within 5 feet of it, can use an action to end the condition early.

Alternatively, you can cast this spell over a minute and target up to a square foot of material to sand it down, as if with sandpaper or a grindstone. Doing so can remove paint and rust, polish metals and erode softer materials.
{@note If you use the Evolving Cantrips supplement, you gain the following additional benefits when you reach certain levels.}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At 5th Level
entries: You can ignore the verbal component of the spell. In addition, when you target a material for sanding down, you can now target up to 5 square feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At 11th Level
entries: The spell's range increases to 10 feet. In addition, when a creature fails the saving throw for this spell, it has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks for the next minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At 17th Level
entries: When you cast this spell, you can target one additional creature within 5 feet of the original target.

Move up to its speed, with one 90-degree turn. Without oars, the rowboat's speed is 0.

items.name: Move.
items.entry: The rowboat can move using its oars.

Small ships typically include a ballista only when they are equipped for combat. If a small ship is equipped with a ballista, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by two and the cargo capacity is reduced by 200lbs.

action: On its turn, the small ship can take 2 actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only 1 action if it has fewer than four crew. It can't take these actions if it has fewer than two crew.

items.name: Fire Ballista.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its {@object ballista||ballistas} (DMG, ch. 8).

items.name: Move.

20 ft. (requires at least 15 crew)
45 ft.; 15 ft. while sailing into the wind; 60 ft. while sailing with the wind.

weapon.name: Ballista
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

Ships typically include a ballista only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a ballista, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by two and the cargo capacity is reduced by 200 lbs.

weapon.name: Dragonsmaw
entries: Each creature in a 30-foot long 5-foot wide line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren���t being worn or carried.

When a Dragonsmaw is destroyed, it explodes in a ball of fire. Each creature within 10ft of the weapon must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren���t being worn or carried.

Ships typically include a Dragonsmaw only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a dragonsmaw, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by two and the cargo capacity is reduced by 200 lbs.

weapon.name: Mangonels
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 200/800 ft. (can't hit targets within 60 ft. of it), one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d10}) bludgeoning damage.

Ships typically include a mangonels only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a mangonel, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by four and the cargo capacity is reduced by 400 lbs.

weapon.name: Naval Ram
entries: The ship has advantage on all saving throws relating to crashing when it crashes into a creature or an object. Any damage it takes from the crash is applied to the naval ram rather than to the ship. These benefits don't apply if another vessel crashes into the galley.

action: On its turn, the ship can take 3 actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only 2 actions if it has fewer than thirty crew and only 1 action if it has fewer than twenty. It can't take these actions if it has fewer than ten crew.

items.name: Fire Ballista.

entries: Whenever you hit with a critical hit using this weapon, the bonus to this weapon's attack and damage rolls increases by 1 (to a maximum of +10).

entries.name: Curse
entries: This weapon is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a spell such as {@spell remove curse} or a similar effect. While cursed, whenever you hit with a critical hit using this weapon, your hit point maximum is reduced by {@dice 4d4}. If your hit point maximum is reduced to 0 or lower, you instantly die and your soul is consumed by the weapon, you can not be resurrected. If the curse is broken, the weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls is reduced to 0.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When you hit a creature with this weapon, it whispers insults to them. If the hit is a critical hit, the insults are so damming that the creature takes an extra {@dice 1d6} psychic damage.

Spiral grooves on the inside of the barrel force the bullet to spin when fired, helping it travel further. An engineer or blacksmith can rifle the inside of most barrels for 150gp.
The normal and long range of a rifled firearm are both doubled.
This has no effect on firearms with the Wide-Shot property.
This combination melee weapon and firearm is more common as a novelty collector's item, but can still be used as a viable weapon.

When you make an attack with this weapon as part of the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can choose to make a normal melee attack or a ranged attack using the statistics of a {@item wheellock musket|Caligos}.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this ammunition, unless it is magic ammunition that already has a bonus to those rolls.
Ammunition made of or coated with adamantine is unusually effective when used to break objects. Whenever an adamantine ammunition hits an object, the hit is a critical hit.

The adamantine version of twenty pieces of ammunition costs 750 gp more than the normal version and takes at least one workweek to make, whether the ammunition is made of the metal or coated with it. Adamantine ammunition can only be made at The Forge on Thalia.
